abstract: New York City's housing laws are complex by any standards, as reflected by June ruling from Judge Phyllis K Saxe of Manhattan Housing Court; Saxe has ordered eviction of Tomoko Watabe, market-rate tenant in West Village apartment, in order to undo illegal eviction of previous tenant Otto Thompson; while in prison, Thompson had a legal roommate pay the rent in order to retain rent-controlled lease on apartment; ruling negates default judgment of eviction that Thompson's landlord was awarded in 2010.
lead_paragraph: An ex-convict is fighting to return to the Manhattan apartment he had lived in for decades. But someone else lives there.

headline.main: An Eviction to Make Way for an Ex-Convict’s Return
headline.print_headline: An Eviction to Make Way for an Ex-Convict’s Return

snippet: An ex-convict is fighting to return to the Manhattan apartment he had lived in for decades. But someone else lives there.
